# Pull Request

## Description

Brief description of what this PR does.

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Code quality improvement (refactoring, optimization)
- [ ] Test coverage improvement
- [ ] Build/CI improvement

## Motivation and Context

Why is this change needed? What problem does it solve?

Fixes #(issue number)

Detailed list of changes:

- Changed X to Y
- Added Z functionality
- Refactored A for better B

How has this been tested?

- [ ] Tested locally

## Screenshots (if applicable)

For UI changes, before/after screenshots.

## Checklist

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have run linting (flake8/black) and fixed any issues

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated CHANGELOG.md with my changes
- [ ] I have added docstrings to new functions/classes

### Sacred Law Compliance

- [ ] I have NOT modified protected files (marked `protected: true` in shareware.yml)
- [ ] I developed in /lab/ first before promoting to the repository
- [ ] I have read THE_BOOK_OF_STULATIONS.md and respect the Loader
- [ ] My changes do not compromise the protection pattern

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

### Repository

- [ ] My commits are atomic and have descriptive messages
- [ ] I have rebased on the latest main branch
- [ ] I have resolved any merge conflicts

Any additional information reviewers should know.

Does this PR depend on other PRs or issues?

- Depends on #(issue/PR number)
- Blocked by #(issue/PR number)
